titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert A. Burt Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Camila Zorrilla Tessler

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday April 18, 2019 at 07:01

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The Robert A. Burt papers contain correspondence and class materials created and collected by Professor Robert A. Burt (LAW 64) during his tenure as Professor of Law at Yale Law School. These papers are directly related to his professional activities and do not contain personal papers. These papers span the years of 1974-2015.

langmaterial.language: The Robert A. Burt Papers are in English.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Robert "Bo" Burt (1939-2015), LAW 1964, was a Yale Law School Professor Emeritus and a member of the faculty of Yale Law School. He recieved his BA from Princeton (1960) and his MA in Jurisprudence from Oxford (1962), followed by his JD from Yale Law School (1964). In 1976 he joined the faculty of Yale Law School after teaching at the University of Michigan and the University of Chicago.

Robert Burt's primary area of study was bioethics and the law, as well as the relationship between the Bible and the law. He taught courses at Yale Law such as "Medicine Ethics" and "The Book of Job and Injustice". He wrote six books over the course of his career, including "Take Care of Strangers: The Rule of Law in Doctor-Patient Relations" and "In the Whirlwind: God and Humanity in Conflict."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Robert A. Burt papers contain correspondence and class materials created and collected by Professor Robert A. Burt (LAW 64) during his tenure as Professor of Law at Yale Law School. These papers are directly related to his professional activities and do not contain personal papers. These papers span the years of 1974-2015.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Robert A. Burt Papers are arranged in two series: I. Correspondence, 1976-1986. II, Course materials 1970-2015.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Restricted Correspondence folders are restricted to researcher access due to FERPA regulations and cannot be accessed until January 1, 2062.
Computer files that are located in the course materials series are restricted to researcher access until the digital processing of these materials is complete.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for the Robert A. Burt Papers has been transferred to Yale University. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Photocopied and published course materials have mostly been removed, unless not described in course overviews.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Correspondence series contains the professional correspondence of Professor Robert Burt during his tenure at Yale Law from the years of 1976-1986.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Correspondence series is organized chronologically.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted due to FERPA until January 1, 2062.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Course Materials series contains lists of courses and lists of materials used by Professor Burt during his tenure as a professor. Published material listed in the course materials have been removed. This series dates from 1970-2015.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Course Materials series is arranged alphabetically, and then chronologically for courses taught more than once.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Computer files are restricted to researcher access until they have been fully processed.

did.unittitle: Biotechnology and Anti-social Conduct: Controlling the Controller lecture
The Book of Job and Injustice
The Constitutional Case for Same-Sex Marriage lecture
The Constitution, the Supreme Court, and the Concept of Authority in American Political Life

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original born digital files, as well as preservation masters, may not be accessed due to their fragility. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist request that they be made. Born digital files cannot be accessed remotely. System requirements include a Manuscripts and Archives computer and file viewing software.
